alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 9:05PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Jewell, southwestern Nuckolls and southeastern Webster Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 905 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Guide Rock, or 38 miles northwest of Beloit, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Guide Rock around 920 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bostwick, Superior and Webber. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
